body_html: I might be off here, but maybe you should look into using a cluster manager like Mesos, Kubernetes, etc. Even though you're only running on a single node, I think these should still help you schedule and run your separate models on different CPUs. Or I believe you can manually achieve something similar with multiple docker containers, but using a framework is probably easier.

body: I might be off here, but maybe you should look into using a cluster manager like Mesos, Kubernetes, etc. Even though you're only running on a single node, I think these should still help you schedule and run your separate models on different CPUs. Or I believe you can manually achieve something similar with multiple docker containers, but using a framework is probably easier.
